elements.title: Graphene battery breakthrough
elements.description: The startup [Nanotech Energy](https://nanotechenergy.com/) claims to be “the world’s top supplier of graphene” and plans to release a non-flammable, environmentally friendly lithium battery that can charge “18 times faster than anything that is currently available on the market” — within the next year.

elements.title: Cambridge Carbon Map
elements.description: The Cambridge Carbon Map will bring together town and University organisations to create a public map of carbon emissions for the city of Cambridge. It will be accessible to anyone with a mobile phone and will allow you to compare carbon emissions for organisations with a simple tap on your mobile screen.

elements.title: ICIS - Energy
elements.description: global source of Independent Commodity Intelligence Services - ICIS connect data, markets and customers to create a comprehensive, trusted view of the global commodities markets, enabling smarter business decisions that optimise the world’s resources.

elements.title: Recycling lithium-ion batteries from electric vehicles
elements.description: Here we outline and evaluate the current range of approaches to electric-vehicle lithium-ion battery recycling and re-use, and highlight areas for future progress.

elements.title: SEG - Smart Export Guarantee
elements.description: SEG - Smart Export Guarantee  is the new way for small generation to have a feed-in tariff, starting after the old one dies on March 31st 2019. Some useful notes from [the Energyst](https://theenergyst.com/smart-export-guarantee-neither-smart-nor-much-of-a-guarantee/)

elements.description: Low carbon and renewable energy economy, UK: 2017  Final results from the Low Carbon and Renewable Energy Survey on the low carbon and renewable energy economy, 31.1.19

elements.title: machine learning
elements.description: machine learning  can boost the value of wind energy, from a Google company

elements.title: provided a millisecond response
elements.description: the case for static storage: how Tesla big battery in Australia  provided a millisecond response  to adjust frequency when a coal plant stopped working

elements.title: build a 200MW battery
elements.description: AEMO and ARENA  build a 200MW battery  for extreme peaks, twice the size of the Tesla big battery

elements.title: link
elements.description: IPCC (intergovernmental panel on climate change) report on 1.5C released in early October 2018:  link  this is the **badass doc** that worked as wake up call for loads of people

elements.description: **Pandora’s box!** So much content here, loads of innovation projects and reports in a single place  link  very interesting sections: low carbon London and smarter network storage in the large scale projects section

elements.title: national grid eso
elements.description: Electricity System Operator UK  national grid eso  another website full of content, innovation, fundings, etc. mainly from the TSO point of view

elements.title: electrical grid mapping
elements.description: An algorithm for  electrical grid mapping  by Facebook based on image analysis and a modified Dijkstra algorithm

elements.title: Data Communication Company
elements.description: Data Communication Company  has built and maintained the secure national infrastructure that underpins the roll-out of smart meters across Great Britain.

elements.title: a very close look at carbon capture
elements.description: a very close look at carbon capture , new materials that could make it very efficient and feasible

elements.title: The Smart Cities Information System (SCIS)
elements.description: The Smart Cities Information System (SCIS)  is a knowledge platform to exchange data, experience and know-how and to collaborate on the creation of smart cities. List of [demonstration projects](https://smartcities-infosystem.eu/scis-clusters/demonstration-projects), and some projects funded:

elements.title: Renewable energy hub UK
elements.description: Renewable energy hub UK  big marketplace for installers and generation devices

elements.title: Microsoft announced
elements.description: Microsoft announced  that in early 2020 it will open an AI Centre of Excellence for Energy in the United Arab Emirates – a global first for the company – to empower organisations in the industry in accelerating digital transformation, equipping the workforce with AI skills, as well as collaborating on coalitions to address sustainability and safety challenges.

elements.title: Protect Earth
elements.description: Protect Earth  is a list of links divided by categories and tags and compiled to a website (a bit like this repo, but better :smile:), the source is [here on Github](https://github.com/philsturgeon/awesome-earth)

elements.title: En-roads scenario simulation
elements.description: En-roads scenario simulation  helps to improve decision-maker understanding of the dynamics of the climate-energy-land-economic system, particularly focusing on policy-makers, citizens, educators, and business leaders [FAQ](https://docs.climateinteractive.org/projects/en-roads/en/latest/guide/general_faqs.html)
